questions.text: Mr Kashyap purchased an air conditioner for ₹12000 and sold it for ₹15000. What was the profit percentage?

In terms of percentage profit, which is the best transaction?
C.P. (in ₹)	Profit (in ₹)
(a) 36, 17
(b) 50, 24
(c) 40, 19
(d) 60, 29
If books bought at prices ranging from ₹200 to ₹350 are sold at prices ranging from ₹300 to ₹425, what is the greatest possible profit that might be made in selling eight books?
A shopkeeper bought an article for ₹2090.42. Approximately, what will be the percentage profit if he sold that article for ₹2602.58?
The cost price of an article is ₹7840. What should be the selling price of the article so that there is a profit of 7%?

Rakesh purchased a mobile phone for ₹5400 and a refrigerator for ₹9600. He sold the mobile phone at three-fourths of its cost price and the refrigerator at 1 1/3 of its cost price. What was the profit/loss?

Rajni purchased a mobile phone and a refrigerator for ₹12000 and ₹10000 respectively. She sold the refrigerator at a loss of 12 percent and the mobile phone at a profit of 8 percent. What is her overall loss/profit?
Mohanlal purchased a TV set for ₹12500 and spent ₹300 on transportation and ₹800 on installation. At what price should he sell it so as to earn an overall profit of 15%?
Harshad bought 15 pieces of DVD players @ ₹4500 each and sold all of them at the total price of ₹81000. What is the percent profit earned in the deal?
Alfred buys an old scooter for ₹4700 and spends ₹800 on its repairs. If he sells the scooter for ₹5800, his gain percent is
A shopkeeper purchased 70 kg of potatoes for ₹420 and sold the whole lot at the rate of ₹6.50 per kg. What will be his gain percent?
Sam purchased 20 dozens of toys at the rate of ₹375 per dozen. He sold each one of them at the rate of ₹33. What was his percentage profit?
100 oranges are bought at the rate of ₹350 and sold at the rate of ₹48 per dozen. The percentage of profit or loss is:
A sells an article which costs him ₹400 to B at a profit of 20%. B then sells it to C, making a profit of 10% on the price he paid to A. How much does C pay B?
By selling an article for ₹100, a man gains ₹15. Then, his gain % is:
A trader buys some goods for ₹150. If the overhead expenses be 12% of cost price, then at what price should it be sold to earn 10%?
A man buys 10 articles for ₹8 and sells them at the rate of ₹1.25 per article. His profit is:
If an article is sold at 200 percent profit, then the ratio of its cost price to its selling price will be:
If the ratio of cost price and selling price of an article be 10 : 11, the percentage of profit is:
A trader sells an article and loses 1 12/2%. The ratio of cost price to the selling price is:
A person buys an article for p and sells it for q thereby gaining r%. The selling price in terms of cost price may be written as (R.R.B., 2005)
The owner of a furniture shop charges his customer 28% more than the cost price. If a customer paid ₹23680 for a dining table set, then what was the original price of the dining set?
A gold bracelet is sold for ₹14500 at a loss of 20%. What is the cost price of the gold bracelet? (Bank Recruitment, 2007)
A shopkeeper expects a gain of 1 22 % on his cost price. If in a week, his sale was of ₹392, what was his profit?
The sale price of an article including the sales tax is ₹616. The rate of sales tax is 10%. If the shopkeeper has made a profit of 12%, then the cost price of the article is
A shopkeeper buys 144 eggs at 90 paise each. On the way, 20 eggs were broken. He sold the remaining eggs at ₹1.20 each. The percentage gain or loss is (R.R.B., 2006)
Abhishek purchased 140 shirts and 250 trousers at ₹450 and ₹550 respectively. He sold each shirt for ₹540 and each trouser for ₹600. Find his overall profit percentage.

A person purchased 10 dozen pens at the rate of ₹4 per dozen. On checking, he found that 20 pens were not working. In order to earn 25% profit, he should sell the remaining pens each at (P.C.S., 2008)

Saransh purchased 120 reams of paper at ₹80 per ream. He spent ₹280 on transportation, paid octroi at the rate of 40 paise per ream and paid ₹72 to the coolie. If he wants to have a gain of 8%, what must be the selling price per ream?

A person bought 20 litres of milk at the rate of ₹8 per litre. He got it churned after spending ₹10 and 5 kg of cream and 20 litres of toned milk were obtained. If he sold the cream at ₹30 per kg and toned milk at ₹4 per litre, his profit in the transaction is
Jacob bought a scooter for a certain sum of money. He spent 10% of the cost on repairs and sold the scooter for a profit of ₹1100. How much did he spend on repairs if he made a profit of 20%?

A manufacturer undertakes to supply 2000 pieces of a particular component at ₹25 per piece. According to his estimates, even if 5% fail to pass the quality tests, then he will make a profit of 25%. However, as it turned out, 50% of the components were rejected. What is the loss to the manufacturer? (M.A.T., 2003)

Ronit and Vinit purchased a scooter for ₹25000 and sold the same for ₹26250. If at the time of purchase Ronit paid 1 1/2 times as much as Vinit, how much did Vinit receive out of profit? (P.C.S., 2004)
A trader buys a chair for ₹600 and sells it for ₹765 at a credit of 4 months. Reckoning money worth 6% p.a., his gain percent is
By selling a bicycle for ₹2850, a shopkeeper gains 14%. If the profit is reduced to 8%, then the selling price will be (S.S.C., 2010)
When a plot is sold for ₹18,700, the owner loses 15%. At what price must the plot be sold in order to gain 15%? (A.A.O. Exam, 2003)
A fruitseller sells mangoes at the rate of ₹9 per kg and thereby loses 20%. At what price per kg, he should have sold them to make a profit of 5%?
Raju purchased an item for ₹8200 and sold it at a gain of 25%. From that amount he purchased another item and sold it at a loss of 20%. What is his overall gain/loss? (Bank Recruitment, 2010)
A property dealer sells a house for ₹6,30,000 and in the bargain makes a profit of 5%. Had he sold it for ₹5,00,000, then what percentage of loss or gain he would have made?
A shopkeeper sells one transistor for ₹840 at a gain of 20% and another for ₹960 at a loss of 4%. His total gain or loss percent is
